name: Dwarven Combat Rogue - Rogue 11 / Fighter 2 / Weapon Master 7
author: magaiti

posts.author: magaiti
posts.content:
This is a STR-based rogue build,
combining Heavy Armor S&B style with WM crits and full set of rogue locks&traps skills.
Playable 1-20 PvE [PvM]

Pros:
 - WM crit profile
 - Crippling Strike
 - 6d6 Sneak Attack
 - maxed rogue skills
Cons:
 - low saves

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
A nice offensive sword & board combatant, magaiti.

Perhaps you can move knockdown & blind fight earlier to the build? I would also keep a nice stack of clarity potions in his bag always with that will save, the others are oka-ish.

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
I'd change the level split myself going ro 9 f4 wm7. Starting out with 2 levels ro then the 4 fighters then 6 more ro. To pick up your feats faster now that im thinking more about it r7 f6 w7 would be even better moving blindfight and knockdown earlier picking up ws and maybe Iron will. Sure you lose sneak damage and crippling strike but the tradeoff might be worth it.

Valerfor you want to crunch those #'s in the cbc ?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
@darknight, the 7/6/7 set-up is indeed a good & proven build as i have seen in 20 lvl PW's, a nice alternative to the overused 10/3/7, which is what most people make.

magaiti's build is fine though, he has a feel of originality to it and crippling strike is a nice addition, although you need TWF to make full use of it.

Sorry, i don't use the CBC though-just yellow notes, then paper ;) Hip & empyre would be the most advanced users of it (CBC).

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
I do the pad of paper myself the wife absolutely hates it. All my postings are currently from my phone so no "real" builds for awhile.
Back to the build... that will save is just plain ugly so like valerfor said clarity potions will be your friend . posts.author: magaiti
posts.content:
With this level split you can take either KD or BF as early as level 3 (at 2nd fighter level), at the cost of moving ImpCrit to lvl 15 or 18.
7/6/7 split sounds promising, though it will cost you 24 skill points.
